meanings.definition: The act of providing or serving as a border or margin.
meanings.sent1: The garden looked neat with colorful flowers along the edging.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed the stones as edging around the flower bed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the edging of the lawn as a secret pathway.
meanings.sent4: The edging of the book was adorned with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The bright red edging of the flag caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The act of moving gradually or cautiously.
meanings.sent1: The edging of the cat towards the mouse was slow and deliberate.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the edging of the car towards the cliff edge.
meanings.sent3: The edging of the turtle across the road was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Her edging towards the finish line showed determination.
meanings.sent5: The edging of the snail along the leaf was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The act of finishing or trimming the edges of something.
meanings.sent1: The tailor added a delicate lace edging to the dress.
meanings.sent2: She carefully applied the gold edging to the picture frame.
meanings.sent3: The chef's specialty was the edging of cakes with intricate designs.
meanings.sent4: The artist used a sharp tool for the edging of the clay sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The edging of the paper with colorful markers made it stand out.
